places_with_reviews.name: Palani Aandavar Temple, Bhavani
places_with_reviews.address: CMVM+636, Palanipuram, Bhavani, Tamil Nadu 638301, India

reviews.text:
Great place to enlighten and get inspired by lord Muruga is Palani . Lot of Murugan temple is located in Tamil Nadu . Place near to Coimbatore, Salam, Erode , Darapuram, Thirupoor , Pollachi and Udumalai is sure Palani temple .

Must visit for Lord Murugan devotees. Om Muruga , Om Muruga 🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

Always a mind relaxing experience. Pure bliss to stay at Palani and take an evening walk to the Temple through its crowd. It might be difficult to take the hundreds of steps and reach atop, but the view, the lord, and spiritual enlightenment the peak holds is an out of words experience. Better reach the place by afternoon and start the climb at 3pm itself, so even if it is a crowded day, within the same day one can reach the top in less than 2 hours. For elderly or physical challenged people the temple offers rope car as well as winch train services. There will be two queues starting from the footwear storage room for the winch train. Less expensive queue will take more time only because every next train will not board people from this line, but the other queue will move fast taking people on all consecutive trains. Palani crowd is lovely, but watch your surroundings and be safe, keep alert about your belongings and especially keep an eye on your children.
The real mystery is here on the Idol. The powerful ancient Navapashanam Murugan Statue. Nine Poisonous proportions is giving the medicinal and positive vibes and more and more energy to the world.

Temple on top ofna hill which is having a view. We have multiple queue options like dharma darsan whichbis free queue and 10 Rupees queue 100 Rupees queue etc. The very first queue on the front of the temple is the 10 Rupees queue. Most ofnthe people get into this queue without knowing ans this makesnthis queue a long one. Its always best to chedk how long is the free queue first and select the queue. Free queue will be on the right side of the temple or from the back. It depends on the rush. Info: Thanka Radham will be happening at 7 pm.
No hotels or restaurents on top. But has toilets on top and on the way.

Is there any review needed for this !!!!!
Never ever — One of famous temple in TamilNadu and World famous Murugan Temple which is located in Palani. We can only reach the temple via Rope car, Winch or by Walk. There is no road facility to uphill.
By Walk is having 2 routes one is normal steps and another is yaanai thadam which Wil be kind of easy one compared to steps.
It Wil take max 20 mins by this way.

Been there during the early hours to worship Lord Shiva who resides majestically on peaceful shores of the riverbanks of 3 rivers. The sculptures tells great stores of the craftsmanship and tales of a British collector who had a divine encounter with the goddess. I hope people flocking to this place for various rituals keep this place clean and temple management ensures they preserve this wonderful place of worship with utmost cleanliness especially on the banks of the river.

What an experience one can have at this magnificent temple . The huge Gopuram welcoming you , the Perumal residing inside a shiva temple, three rivers coming together at this place clear water flowing amidst huge stones and boulders. Temple must be very old one. Here shiva abd oaravathi are named as Sangameswarar and Thayar is called Vedanayagi. Perumal is named as Adikesava Perumal and Thayar soundaravalli. Sculpturer have done an astonishing job on white stones and granites . Three rivers coming together here are Cauvery, Bhavani and invisible Amritanadhi. Sitting in tree shade and watching the river water flowing by is a serene experience . Don’t buy food packets to give to beggars as they say it is doing good, but once you turn back the same packet comes to the shop & money exchanged. I got duped .

The beautiful temple, the main deity is lord Shiva as Sangameshwarar and Vedhanayagi amman. We also see a lord Narayanan and goddesses Lakshmi in this temple. The birds sounds are natural treat to your ears in the evening time on this river side temple... You can meditate and cultivate your inner peace here

Bhavani Sangameshwara Swamy Temple is not merely a place for darshan; it provides a sacred space for Saradha Karmas, fostering a deeper spiritual connection. The temple stands as a significant site where numerous devotees find solace and fulfillment of their desires. The belief in attaining moksha at this divine location adds a profound dimension to the spiritual experience.

The temple's atmosphere resonates with a sense of devotion, making it a destination where visitors can not only witness the divine but actively participate in sacred rituals. It serves as a spiritual haven, allowing devotees to seek both worldly blessings and the ultimate goal of moksha. Overall, Bhavani Sangameshwara Swamy Temple holds a unique and revered place for those on a spiritual journey.

Om namah shivaya 🙏. One of the Paadal Petra Sthalam (Praised by Nayanmars). Located at Bank of Kaveri River and Bhavani River (Both rivers are confluence in this location). Located very near to temple bus stop (Walkable distance only). Main deity of this temple is Lord Shiva. Frequent city and Mofussil buses available from Erode which is nearest city from the temple. You can reach from Bhavani Byepass Stop to this temple through city buses whic is available at the same location.
Good Place to Visit & Spends time with family

reviews.text: I visited here as for tour and had good views of seeing the river flow, as you can see I posted two pics of alternate days, so can't expect when the flow will be high or low but careful. You can even visit temples of shiva, Ganapati, and many are there......

Auspicious place to pray for beloved ones after life. Bhavani and cauvery river exact place of joining, so it became auspicious for all poojas and other activities.

People usually go there and do bath and leave clothes in river itself. Because of that, I am seeing lot of pollution. Government or temple management can take decision to control it by collecting clothes in one place instead of throwing in river.

Most I important thing, ladies can comfortably take bath in river, there is a government provided dressing rooms available. So they can comfortably change clothes there.

Heavy crowd so can't take pictures in phone. Car and bike parking there with reasonable price. Park maintain is okay.

Last time I visited here for my dad thithiy it's payable and we need to take tickets worth rs70 but the person asking 100rs with out any reason, Last time I had fight for 30rs. Iyer charge is separately.

Too much of waste dress are in the river actually it's have dress collection bin near river but no one follow.

Bathing river is awesome, no boating available.

It's a Eswaran temple situated near bavani bye pass. It's one of the best temples for parikaram. It's another name is kooduthurai sangameswarar temple. Because river cauvery and river bhavani are met here. So this sivan temple is in between these two rivers. Ammavasai is the correct day to visit this temple for parikaram.
Very spacious, calm, refreshing cauvery river bath, ancient siva vishnu temple, ideal for a picnic

This is a place where bhavani river and Kaveri river meets. People believes that a third clean water stream is flowing from Arulmigu Sangameshwara Shiva temple, named Amutha Nadhi. Hence it is often called as Triveni too.

People from far distances visit this place to perform funeral/yearly rituals here.

Place is not that clean as you can see lot of plastic wastes here and there, even in the river.

Also, auto/cab facility is not available here.

The Uthandrayan Temple in Bhavani is a serene and spiritually enriching destination. The temple's architecture is a blend of traditional South Indian style with intricate carvings and vibrant paintings. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, it attracts devotees seeking blessings and solace. The peaceful ambiance and the surrounding natural beauty make it a perfect place for meditation and introspection. The temple's management ensures cleanliness and order, enhancing the overall experience. A visit to Uthandrayan Temple promises a fulfilling spiritual journey and a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of India.
Good place to spend time with family.

places_with_reviews.name: Vedhagiri hill URACHIKOTTAI
places_with_reviews.address: Urachikottai, FMGR+P69, Perumal Kovil Steps, Tamil Nadu 638301, India

reviews.text: Very devotional place. Not so far from bhavani. You have parking facilities. Try to start walking by morning because it will be too hot during afternoon. It takes roughly 1 hr to ascend and 45 mins I to descend. So peaceful and calm. Beautiful panoramic view of kaveri river. Om namo narayana!

You can see a wonderful view from the top which gives a good experience while climbing the place. Here you have to walk only to reach the top .  There is a drinking water facility at the top of the hill and prasadam provide  every Saturday morning.

Urachikottai is a small Village/hamlet in Bhavani Block in Erode District of Tamil Nadu State, India. It comes under Urachikottai Panchayath. It is located 31 KM towards North from District head quarters Erode. 13 KM from Bhavani. 392 KM from State capital Chennai

Urachikottai Pin code is 638301 and postal head office is Bhavani .

Vellaiyampalayam ( 2 KM ) , Chinnathambipalayam ( 3 KM ) , Pazhaiya Mettur ( 3 KM ) , Annamaduvu ( 3 KM ) , Andiyur ( 4 KM ) are the nearby Villages to Urachikottai. Urachikottai is surrounded by Bhavani Block towards South , Ammapet Block towards East , Gopichettipalaiyam Block towards west , Thoockanaickenpalaiyam Block towards west .

Bhavani , Suriyampalayam , Periyasemur , Erode are the near by Cities to Urachikottai.

This Place is in the border of the Erode District and Namakkal District. Namakkal District Pallipalayam is East towards this place .
Beautiful hill. Takes around 40 mins to climb and it is an easy one. The path is levelled stone path coupled with steps. Not much people but it was so nice.

Urachikottai is one of the tallest hill temple in erode region. There is no vehicle facilities while climbing. We wanna walk above the hill which will give an fantastic trek as it is covered with trees and the scenery will be awe..😍 we cannot feel the warmth as we reach up the hill. The passage for walking has well maintained. Different age groups can climb the hill for a wonderful experience...🤟🏽
